Package giba.model

Class Tasks

  • java.lang.Object
    • giba.model.Tasks
  • public class Tasks
extends java.lang.Object
    The Tasks class is responsible for handling the tasks created and displayed on the dashboard.
    Author:
    Andrew Cavallaro

    • Constructor Summary

      Default constructor.

      Overloaded constructor.
      Tasks​(java.lang.String taskName, java.lang.String frequency, java.lang.String details, java.time.LocalDate date)
      The tasks constructor that creates a new Task object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addToDatabase()
      The addToDatabase method adds the task and it's fields to the database and will be shown on the dashboard landing screen.

      Number of days (frequency) getter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tasks

        public Tasks()
        Default constructor.

      • Tasks

        public Tasks​(java.lang.String taskName,
             java.lang.String frequency,
             java.lang.String details,
             java.time.LocalDate date)
        The tasks constructor that creates a new Task object. It transforms the combo box selection string into an integer and initializes the nextDate object.
        Parameters:
        taskName - Name of the task being created
        frequency - Frequency the task needs to be completed at
        details - Details pertaining to the task being created
        date - Today's date

      • Tasks

        public Tasks​(java.lang.String taskName,
             int frequency,
             java.lang.String details,
             java.sql.Date completionDate,
             java.sql.Date nextDate)
        Overloaded constructor.
        Parameters:
        taskName - name of the task
        frequency - frequency of the task but in integer format
        details - details of the task
        completionDate - last completion date of the task
        nextDate - next date the task needs to be completed by

    • Method Detail

      • updateDatabase

        public void updateDatabase​(java.sql.Date today,
                           java.sql.Date nextDay)
                    throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                           java.sql.SQLException
        The updateDB method is responsible for updating the database anytime a change occurs. An example of a change is completing a task will change the completion and next date to be completed fields.
        Parameters:
        today - today's date
        nextDay - the day the task is next to be completed
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - yes, it does
        java.sql.SQLException - yes, it does

      • getTaskName

        public java.lang.String getTaskName()
        Task name getter.
        Returns:
        taskName

      • getFrequency

        public int getFrequency()
        Number of days (frequency) getter.
        Returns:
        numberOfDays (frequency int format)

      • addToDatabase

        public void addToDatabase()
                   throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                          java.sql.SQLException
        The addToDatabase method adds the task and it's fields to the database and will be shown on the dashboard landing screen.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - yes, it does
        java.sql.SQLException - yes, it does
